Race.SpecificTitle: City of Tallulah -- .5% S&U Tax - CC - 20 Yrs.
Race.FullText: Shall the City of Tallulah, State of Louisiana (the "City"), be authorized, and to adopt an ordinance, to levy and collect a sales and use tax of one-half of one percent (.5%) on sales at retail, the use, the lease or rental, the consumption, and the storage for use or consumption, of tangible personal property and on sales and services within the City, as defined by law, inclusive (the "Tax") (an estimated $325,000 reasonably expected at this time to be collected from the levy of the Tax for an entire year), for a period of twenty (20) years, commencing effective March 1, 2018, and shall the proceeds of said Tax (after paying the reasonable and necessary expenses of collection and administration) be dedicated and used solely for the following purposes of: (i) providing additional support to the City of Tallulah Police Department, (ii) constructing, paving and improving public streets, and (iii) other capital expenditures, recreation, or any other lawful purpose, including but not limited to securing and paying bonded indebtedness of the City?
